Moderate exercise helps to relieve mental fatigue. For physical fatigue, wait until fully recovered to do exercise. For releasing negative emotions, choose gentle activities with entertainment elements to get the best results. Neurological and muscle functions will be in sync when in a good mood, which will then productively affect exercise. A short period of high-intensity exercise can promote sports performance and speed, but such exercise is not suitable for long durations, and care should be taken to avoid injury. Aerob Exercise intensity should be lower than usual when ill, and if any serious symptoms such as a fever occur, exercise should be stopped. Moderate exercise helps to relieve mental fatigue. For physical fatigue, wait until fully recovered to do exercise. Moderate exercise can transfer negative emotions and relieve stress. Neurological and muscle functions will be in sync when in a good mood, which will then productively affect exercise. This is during a moderate-high intensity exercise. It can effectively consume fat and enhance heart and lung functions and is the target exercise area for most people. Fettverbrennung Exercise intensity should be lower than usual when ill, and if any serious symptoms such as a fever occur, exercise should be stopped. Moderate exercise helps to relieve mental fatigue. For physical fatigue, wait until fully recovered to do exercise. Moderate exercise can transfer negative emotions and relieve stress. Neurological and muscle functions will be in sync when in a good mood, which will then productively affect exercise. This is a moderate intensity exercise interval. A large part of consumption will come from fat, which is an ideal choice for a novice. Kein Training Exercise intensity should be lower than usual when ill, and if any serious symptoms such as a fever occur, exercise should be stopped. Moderate exercise helps to relieve mental fatigue. For physical fatigue, wait until fully recovered to do exercise. Moderate exercise can transfer negative emotions and relieve stress. For best results, increase exercise intensity and duration until heart rate is within 50-85% of its maximum.
